clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 1 Study of OCV-C02 in Patients With Advanced or Relapsed Colorectal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Study of OCV-C02 in Patients With Advanced or Relapsed Colorectal Cancer Who Are Refractory or Intolerant to Standard Chemotherapy

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the safety and tolerability of OCV-C02 in Patients With Advanced or Relapsed Colorectal Cancer Who Are Refractory or Intolerant to Standard Chemotherapy

detailed_description.textblock:
The incidence of dose limiting toxicity (DLT) will be evaluated in cohorts of six patients by starting OCV-C02 administration at dose level 1 (OCV-103 and OCV-104 at 0.3 mg each), increasing the dose to dose level 2 (at 1 mg each), and then up to dose level 3 (at 3 mg each). Once-weekly administration will be repeated four times in each treatment cycle, and the incidence of DLT from Day 1 to Day 29 will be evaluated.
At the end of Cycle 1, patients who wish to continue OCV-C02 treatment and have provided their written consent will be permitted to continue participation in the trial using the same dosing schedule for each subsequent cycle as that for Cycle 1.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE), ver. 4.0

secondary_outcome.description: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE), ver. 4.0
Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) guidelines, version 1.1
DTH reactions，CTL Measurement，Blood Regulatory T Cell Measurement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have human leukocyte antigen (HLA)-A*24:02
- Patients who have histologically-confirmed colorectal cancer (adenocarcinoma)
- Patients with advanced or relapsed colorectal cancer who are refractory or intolerant to standard chemotherapy
- Patients with an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status (PS) of 0 to 1 at the time of enrollment in the trial.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are HIV antibody test positive
- Patients with an active infection
- Patients who have or are suspected to have CNS metastasis of colon cancer (such as metastatis of the brain)
